nodes.bodyText: AFAIK Allows to add... is not gramatically correct. A direct object is needed. E.g. Allows users to.... I prefer "Makes it possible to" ;-). Moreover, I'd avoid using "CDI components". It's a more general tool and it could be used for non-CDI classes as well.

not gramatically correct

You got me there, I'll fix that.

could be used for non-CDI classes as well.

I thought about writing it more generally...but we cannot be sure that if you use it outside of CDI components, it will be taken into account, right? Only extensions that operate with AnnotationStore will see the changes :-/

Only extensions that operate with AnnotationStore will see the changes :-/

Yes, and ideally all extensions that read annotations should use the AnnotationStore. I know it's a utopia and the API is not ready for this kind of usage but still I'd like to keep it as general as possible ;-).

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * Makes it possible to add, remove or alter annotations on various components.
          
          
            
             * Make it possible to add, remove or alter annotations on various components.
          
      
    
    
  

is generally better.
I think we should add some information about when it makes sense to use that one instead of CombinedIndexBuildItem.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,6 +8,17 @@
 
 import io.quarkus.builder.item.SimpleBuildItem;
 
+/**
+ * Represent a Jandex {@link IndexView} on the whole deployment that has a complete CDI-related information.
+ *
+ * Compared to {@link io.quarkus.deployment.builditem.CombinedIndexBuildItem} this index can contain additional classes
+ * that were indexed while bean discovery was in progress.
+ *
+ * It also holds information about all programmatically registered beans and all generated bean classes.

nodes.bodyText: Basically you should use this for anything CDI-related. I will add here something along those lines.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,6 +8,17 @@
 
 import io.quarkus.builder.item.SimpleBuildItem;
 
+/**
+ * Represent a Jandex {@link IndexView} on the whole deployment that has a complete CDI-related information.
+ *
+ * Compared to {@link io.quarkus.deployment.builditem.CombinedIndexBuildItem} this index can contain additional classes
+ * that were indexed while bean discovery was in progress.
+ *
+ * It also holds information about all programmatically registered beans and all generated bean classes.
